item.title: Lempel-Ziv-Welch algorithm
item.description: tags Compression, Complexity papers (Lempel and Ziv 1976; Ziv and Lempel 1977; Ziv and Lempel 1978; Welch 1984; Storer and Szymanski 1982) Context The LZW algorithm was originally designed as a complexity (“randomness”) metric for finite sequences (Lempel and Ziv 1976). It was then extended as a compression algorithm by the same authors to LZ77 (Ziv and Lempel 1977) and LZ78 (Ziv and Lempel 1978). Those last two are the basis of many well known and widely used compression utilities such as GIF, compress (LZW (Welch 1984) ) or DEFLATE, gzip (LZSS (Storer and Szymanski 1982)), etc.
